summary:
I deliver training that sticks and help employees stay competitive in today’s changing work environment. I help organizations retain employees through career development programs. I create modules for learners that meet their specific expectations and help them optimize their learning process.

I have been in business of Learning and Talent Development for 17 years delivering significant performance improvement and employee retention for businesses including United Health Group, Citibank, American Express, CUNA, Aetna, Hyatt Hotels, Intel, British Gas, Ministry of Defence UK. 

I create training programs for the Baby Boomers, Gen X, Millennials and Gen Z. I can manage knowledge transfer projects, from inception to completion, to the specific needs of stakeholders.

school.name: Lal Bahadur Shastri Inst. Of Management
Lady Shri Ram College For Women

profile_positions.description:
	13 week programma VAN STARTBAAN NAAR HARTBAAN van de Werkclub AMIF met Werkclub Utrecht gedaan.
	Nederlands taal niveau B1 gehaald.
profile_positions.title: Member

profile_positions.description:
	Coaching learners to set high goals and guiding them to success.
	Designing and developing course material linked to real-world issues.
	Organizing blended-learning classes in Dutch, American, and British curriculum courses.
profile_positions.title: Coach - Lifelong Learning

profile_positions.description:
Job responsibilities:
	Providing subject matter expertise in project scope definition, risk identification (using failure mode effect analysis (FMEA)), project methodology, resource allocation, based on established project management techniques
	Coordinating with different teams – solutions design, operations, technology, human resources, facilities and completing projects across various functional areas
	Making presentations to management and relevant stakeholders on project updates, project cycle and expected results

Career highlights and initiatives:
	Transitioned to Cebu, Philippines a 391 FTE process for United Health Group, establishing process flows, targets and KPIs for 2 pilot voice processes
	Awarded the ‘Bravo! Opal’ recognition by the client for my efforts
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Job responsibilities:
	Facilitating Webex trainings, seminars and workshops in leadership development – New Leader’s Program, Emerging Leader’s Program, Situational Leadership for the teams in US, India, Philippines and Colombia
 	Creating a learning-linked career progression path for the front-line teams and middle management (in India and Philippines). This was a talent and workforce planning project, in anticipation of future growth, after collaboration with internal stakeholders
	Reviewing content and making changes to it to reflect current business realities and processes, the learner profile; on the basis of feedback from training, in collaboration with business leaders and subject matter experts
	Designing and deploying Talent Management Assessment methodologies 
	Training interventions and succession planning initiatives for high talent employee pool (HIPOs) to increase their engagement with the organization and to control attrition
	Leading transformation projects aimed at streamlining or enhancing the processes

Career highlights and initiatives:
	Introduced the ‘Hire Smart’ compulsory training certification for the Recruitment Team. This helped reduce the number of no call no show (NCNS) and increased the average retention rate of a new hire
	Developed a mentoring and coaching culture for the British Gas processes
	Designed and facilitated the ‘Self-Branding’ workshop for the American Express process business leaders
	Set up a new delivery center for EXL in Bogota, Colombia
	Migrated to Manila, Philippines a pilot process for a US insurance client and build on it for a double headcount ramp-up
	Awarded ‘The Alchemist’ for my initiatives
profile_positions.title: Senior Manager - Capability Development/Migrations

profile_positions.description:
Job responsibilities:
	Facilitating trainings to enable the successful attainment of learning and development goals (Kirkpatrick’s L1 – L4) by individuals and teams
	Supporting leadership development through off-site and in-house management development programs 
	Initiating organization development initiatives such as career and succession planning, re-vamp of the performance management process through the creation of team goals, deployment of performance dashboards on the shop floor
	Identifying training and development needs within the organisation through customer satisfaction surveys – voice of customer (VOC), net promoter score (NPS), job analysis, appraisal schemes and regular consultation with business managers
	Designing training courses and programs to meet training needs. Revising the training programs as necessary, to adapt to changes occurring in the work environment
	Creating a robust learning and development process: plan, design, delivery, evaluation, and continually improving to ensure it reflects strategic goals. Designing the organisation’s yearly training plan and monthly training calendar

Career highlights and initiatives:
	Reduced the training man-days of a new joiner from 13 to 11, while maintaining efficiency and adding mandatory operations’ certification (using the 70-20-10 model of L&D)
	Developed initiatives to create a customer service focused culture in the organisation and improve employee engagement such as Better Never Stops (BNS), Graduation Day, Grammar Club
	Created a growth path for high turnover roles in the organisation, using competency mapping
	Facilitated an Image Management and Selling Skills workshop for the Sales teams
profile_positions.title: Senior Manager - Training & Development

profile_positions.description:
Job responsibilities:
 Ensuring that statutory training requirements are met by conducting general training courses including Safety Familiarization, Ship Familiarization, Company Orientation, Hospitality, Respect and Working in a multi-cultural environment, Wellness Training, English as a Second Language.
 Amending and revising programs as necessary, in order to adapt to the changes that occur in the work environment. Evaluating the training and development programs.
 Supporting the development of management personnel on the ship, through the implementation of the Management Training program. Conducting Position based training (NCL’s train-the-trainer program) to enhance the ship’s focus on service excellence by training and assisting others to train people.
 Overseeing the ship’s Learning Center. Responsible for all training-related record keeping.
 Planning the ship's monthly Training Plan and Calendar.
 Helping line managers and trainers solve specific training problems, either on a one-to-one basis or in groups.
profile_positions.title: Training Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Job responsibilities:
	Conducting new hire orientation, on-the-job training as well as industry-acclaimed training sessions - Hyatt on Skills Training, Smart Selling
	Developing supervisory and management personnel in the hotel, through the implementation of management training programs and workshops
	Identifying training needs within each department using guest comment cards, Maritz survey reports, Hotel IQ results, duty manager’s logs and in discussion with the managers
	Planning and monitoring the hotel's yearly training budget, training plan and training calendar; reviewing progress and making recommendations where necessary
	Conducting audits to evaluate the effectiveness of the trainings conducted and monitor the departmental standards as defined in the departmental operations manual
	Coordinating employee engagement surveys, communicating the results, organizing action planning sessions to ensure that the relevant suggestions are implemented and rolling out OD interventions to enhance engagement
	Conducting performance development discussions with the training team
	Implementing the Corporate Leadership Trainee and Management Trainee program

Career highlights and initiatives:
	In line with the vision of Hyatt to expand to 100 hotels in India, established the School of Hospitality (a blend of self-learning and instructor-led training modules) for the employees to provide them continuous, on-site learning and enable internal mobility
	Created two leadership development series for middle-management – a 2-day Team Leader’s Development Program and a 3-day Assistant Manager’s Development Program
	Adapted the Harvard Manage Mentor (HMM) courses with instructor-led café sessions to reinforce learning
	Created micro-learning for the millennials – 5-minute training sessions during the pre-shift meeting to reinforce key points, 20-minute skills training sessions by breaking a task into steps (the 20 minutes included the trainee performing independently)
profile_positions.title: Training Manager

profile_positions.description:
Developing Web-based Training (WBT) products for Intel, Symantec, WebEx, Amway, Logica, Reliance, and Income Tax Department; contributing in the design and development in all the courses.

Conducting Beta Teach (Train the Trainer) programs for the Instructor-led Trainings (ILTs) for the various clients.

Conducting refresher sessions for the entire studio on the various ID strategies.

Analyzing client requirements, designing knowledge solutions, and conducting presales activities. Recommending and implementing ID strategies to develop learning material for ILTs and WBTs for corporate clients.

Designing and developing the review and assessment material.

Ensuring adherence and compliance to project and organization processes and standards.
profile_positions.title: Instructional Designer

profile_positions.description:
Delivering training on complete communication aspects such as American etiquette of telephone, business and social interaction, American culture and facts, skills of listening, grammar.

Conducting voice and accent neutralization sessions for new hires for various financial, customer service, technical and semi-technical processes.

Imparting training to new managers, trainers and language coaches in techniques and skills for training, dealing with employees and various reporting forms/formats and systems.

Scheduling sessions for trainers and tracking their status. Conducting induction sessions for new hires.

Conferring with management/clients and conducting surveys to identify training needs based on projected production processes, changes and other factors.

Performing needs assessment to ensure that training fulfills company needs, objectives and relevant compliance issues. Developing and organizing training manuals and other training materials.

Maintaining attendance data, leave records, attrition reports for trainees and availability reports for trainers.

Monitoring calls, designing process map and refresher modules for various processes.

Screening people on communication aspects for trainability while recruiting.
profile_positions.title: Trainer – Communication & Culture
